newsitem.title: UK: TI confirms Mannesmann sells stake in company.
newsitem.headline: TI confirms Mannesmann sells stake in company.

text.p: TI Group Plc on Thursday confirmed that Mannesmann of Germany had sold its near nine percent stake in the UK firm, following a placing of stock in the London market in early trading.

A spokesman for TI said Mannesmann had sold the stake as part of a decision to focus its activities on the telecoms, engineering and automotive areas. He said the sale did not reflect any disappointment in TI's performance.
TI shares were down 8p at 556-1/2 in heavy volume of 52.6 million shares.

In a later statement, TI chairman Sir Christopher Lewington said the company's collaboration with Mannesmann over the past seven years had been helpful, particularly in developing its activities in Germany.
"I am confident that both companies will continue to pursue opportunities for collaboration wherever they may occur," Lewinton said.

Mannesmann chief executive Dr Joachim Funk said the decision "...was based wholly on factors unconnected with TI where our investment has been extremely satisfactory. The management of TI retains our full confidence."
"Mannesmann is focusing its investments in telecommunications, engineering and automotive and had recently undertaken significant additional commitments in telecommunications ventures," Funk said.
TI confirmed that 42.2 million shares, 8.86 percent of the total, had been sold to institutional investors by brokerages UBS, Cazenove and SBC Warburg.
Mannesmann shares were up 3.20 marks at 586.00 by 0958 GMT.
